data.message: Someone has made a copy of my patented product and put in on Facebook as a free printable. There is only a way to report copyright or trademark infringement. How do I report patent infringement? I respectfully reached out to the person with a cease a desist with no response and the post was not removed. There have been may shares. A purchaser of my product commented on the page that they knew the inventor and had purchased it before and liked it - it was deleted immediately. (again, a respectful  post). Help, please!

replies.message: Thanks for reaching out, Toni. We're sorry to hear you're experiencing this. You can use the copyright report and use the fields provided to explain in detail the situation: http://bit.ly/2AiO0QS. We hope this helps. -Brittany
Facebook , I think if it is on FB that most of rights are gone, unless they say it is not to be copied.
